bill.title: An Act relative to the dispensing of prescription drugs
bill.abstract: Amends GL 94C:24A (Controlled Substances; Written Prescriptions) to authorize a pharmacist to: (i) dispense a 90-day supply for a Schedule VI drug under certain conditions; and (ii) dispense less than a 30-day supply for a prescription if the pharmacist determines the fill or refill to be in the best interest of the patient and the patient agrees to the lesser amount for the purpose of synchronizing the filling of the patient\'s medications on the same date; directs DPH to promulgate regulations to implement these provisions.

status.statusval: Accompanied study order - see HB4681

status.statusval: Signed by Governor

bill.title: AN ACT RELATING TO HUMAN SERVICES - MEDICAL ASSISTANCE - LONG-TERM CARE SERVICE AND FINANCE REFORM (Establishes a public scorecard system to show how long-term care reform is meeting its goals of rebalancing the way services are delivered and moneys are spent on various service types.)

status.statusval: Signed by Governor

bill.title: AN ACT RELATING TO FOOD AND DRUGS -- UNIFORM CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES ACT -- NON-OPIATE DIRECTIVE (Establishes a procedure for individuals to file a revocable voluntary non-opiate directive form with the person's licensed health care practitioner.)

status.statusval: Signed by Governor

bill.title: AN ACT RELATING TO INSURANCE - INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR MENTAL ILLNESS AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE (Includes behavioral health counseling visits and medication maintenance visits as primary care visits for patient cost-sharing requirements under the provisions of a health plan.)

status.statusval: Signed by Governor

bill.title: AN ACT RELATING TO LICENSES GENERALLY (Simplifies the process of doing business in Rhode Island by eliminating unnecessary licensing requirements of various business entities.)

status.statusval: Signed by Governor

bill.title: AN ACT RELATING TO TAXATION -- VETERANS' EXEMPTIONS (Eliminates the requirement that a service person serving in conflicts or undeclared wars receive a campaign ribbon or expeditionary medal in order to receive a property tax exemption.)

status.statusval: Transmitted to Governor
